data.title: Adopt TS 2.5
data.body: Adopt TS 2.5 for VS Code 1.16

data.title: Investigate improving webpack support

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Explore how we can improve support for webpack such as help configuring your `tsconfig.json` file to be in sync with your `webpack.config`.

data.title: Explore Compile On Save Support For TypeScript
data.body: Explore observing the `compileOnSave` setting for `tsconfig` projects to enable more efficient compiling and better project wide error reporting in the editor

data.title: Make ExtensionTipsService multi-root aware
data.body:
As described in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29242

Collects extension recommendations from all roots instead of only for the first root.

data.title: Polish Terminal Quick Pick
data.body:
- Adds a create terminal entry

Fix https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/32149

data.title: Fix spelling in TaskDefinition doc comment
Prototype TS Compile on Save
data.body:
Initial prototype enabling compileOnSave for TypeScript in VSCode

TODO:

- [ ] Possibly gate using an experimental setting. We probably want to wait for TS 2.5 for this as well.
- [ ] Better handle reading `compileOnSave` from project config file. Possibly could benefit from Microsoft/TypeScript#17659
- [X] Request errors for compiled files. Would benefit from Microsoft/TypeScript#17630
- [ ] Investigate why `node_modules` files are sometimes included in `affectedFileList`
- [ ] Check perf implications on larger projects

@dbaeumer Can you please remind me what the main concerns were for enabling compileOnSave?


// cc @sheetalkamat

        "key": "cmd+k",
        "command": "workbench.action.terminal.clear",
        "when": ""
    }
]
```
3. Trigger Intellisense in the value with the when clause.
-> no completion proposals

Steps to Reproduce:

        "when": "ter"
    }
]
```
3. type a character within the `when` clause
-> the left side is re-colorized resulting in a flashing editor and minimap


This is a regression.

data.title: Bug: Git: ssh_askpass: exec(/usr/X11R6/bin/ssh-askpass): No such file or directory

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2 (latest version)
- OS Version: Mac OS Sierra (latest version)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open up VSCode on OS X (Mac, ...)
2. Configure a remote with password authentication (via terminal, f.ex. your own server with password ssh authentication)
3. Click on "synchronize" button in VSCode in the lower left corner
4. You will get an error message saying "Error: Git: ssh_askpass: exec(/usr/X11R6/bin/ssh-askpass): No such file or directory". 
5. There only exists a directory named X11, but not X11R6 on OS X Sierra, so you would have to change the path, unfortunately this is not possible within the settings
6. Nobody is able to upload files (push) to any password-protected server now (if he's using an OS X device)

Updating brew, installing the ssh-akspass package and starting the service didn't help. 

The problem / bug seems to be only on OS X devices, haven't seen any reports about Windows so far. 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: **Yes**

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version

PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Open vScode
2. Debug PS Script

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No 

N/A as native PS is not supported for debugging

The issue is that when I attempt debug a file, VScode throws an error, however, it points to code that no longer exists in the file. In addition, thing like bracket highlighting is not working.

TBH, I have to shutdown and restart VScode every few minutes as after debugging I often find something breaks, perhaps the terminal won't scroll or the debugger will crash.

data.title: Searching for string in files does not always find all files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2
gherkin-indent|Ara|2.0.0
vscode-bad-code-highlighter|bha|0.1.6
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.10.0
jshint|dba|0.10.15
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
xml|Dot|1.9.2
vscode-turtle|fei|1.0.30
php-debug|fel|1.11.1
php-intellisense|fel|1.5.0
php-pack|fel|1.0.1
vscode-sort|hen|0.2.5
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1
crane|Hvy|0.3.8
phpcs|ika|0.7.0
format-indent|Kas|1.3.0
phpmd|lin|1.1.4
vscode-apache|mrm|1.1.1
vscode-duplicate|mrm|1.1.0
oracle-plsql|myc|1.0.3
selectline-statusbar|tom|0.0.2
gitblame|wad|2.0.2
twig|wha|1.0.2

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Searching for a file with a given string inside does not always find all files. I searched the files in a separate terminal and 40 matching files were found. Then I opened one of the files in VS code and then tried the search there again and it returned results for this one file, so I opened another, repeated search and the "another" file was found too etc.

The strange thing is I did this whole operation once shortly before this and it worked fine, all files were found and all texts replaced.

Reproduces without extensions: hard to say - after I disabled them all (in UI), it still didn't work (I don't know if they are disabled right away), but after restarting VS code, it suddenly worked again.

Steps to Reproduce:

Hard to say. I am working on a NFS network drive.

1. look for a string in a large amount of files
2. all is found, replace, save, all is fine
3. revert these changes and try again
4. search result says there are some matches, but not all
5. search through terminal confirms that matches are there, but vscode won't see them
6. restart vscode
7. now it works again

- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)

data.title: No warning for name conflict when renaming parameter
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: none
- typescript compiler: v2.4.2
---

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. create code:

```typescript
function f(p1: string)
{
	return ["a", "b", "c"].findIndex(p => p == p1);
}
```

2. rename parameter `p1` to `p` using *Rename Symbol* command.

**What is expected:**

VS Code shows a warning that the name `p` conflicts with the name of the inner variable `p` (the parameter of the arrow function used as an argument to `findIndex`) and doesn't rename the parameter `p1`.

**The actual result:**

There is no warning and the code is changed to this:

```typescript
function f(p: string)
{
	return ["a", "b", "c"].findIndex(p => p == p);
}
```

In fact, the code is corrupted now because `p == p` is always `true` and the parameter of the function `f` is not used anymore.

Moreover, nor the intellisense nor the compiler complains, because the code is syntactically valid. Thus the damage remains unnoticed.

The same behavior is observed with ordinary functions (non-arrow).

data.title: Core dump
data.body:

data.title: Shell script coloration issue
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new Shell Script

2. Write the following:

PUT_FILES=$( ls -1 *$RUN_DATE* | while read a; do echo "put $a"; done) 
GET_FILES=$( ls -1 *$RUN_DATE* | while read a; do echo "get $a"; done)

data.title: Provide an API to show hover-like tooltip
data.body:
Please provide an API to trigger a hover-like tooltip.

Use case:
In my language extension, I want to let users know the type of the expression by pressing a combination of keys. This is similar to what hover does but:
- It is triggered by pressing a shortcut
- When the same shortcut is pressed again I want to widen the scope of the expression and show the type of a "bigger" expression, etc.

Being able to show custom tooltips is also useful in different scenarios for providing extra information about the code.

- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: MacOS

data.title: Culture specific Import-Module error in PowerShell integrated console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.10.0
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Window 10 in nl-NL culture.
2. In PowerShell integrated console:
```
Import-Module Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive
```
3. Reported error:
```
Cannot find the Windows PowerShell data file 'ArchiveResources.psd1' in directory 'C:\WINDOWS\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive\nl-NL\', or in any parent culture directories.
At C:\WINDOWS\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive\Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive.psm1:27 char:1
+ Import-LocalizedData  LocalizedData -filename ArchiveResources
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (C:\WINDOWS\syst...eResources.psd1:String) [Import-LocalizedData], PSInvalidOperationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : ImportLocalizedData,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportLocalizedData
```
4. The same in powershell.exe console in VSCode of PowerShell ISE does not report an error.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: not possible without PowerShell extension.

data.title: Add support for a debug configuration provider
data.body: This is the real-debug-API replacement for the 'startSession' and 'initialConfigurations' commands that are used today.

data.title: Support match for end keywords
data.body:
Hi community!

I'm happy user of Vim and VSCode :smile: 

On Vim I can match Ruby, Crystal, Elixir, Lua, Julia `end` keywords using [matchit](https://github.com/tmhedberg/matchit).

By example, the following code is in [Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org/) on Vim:

![ezgif-4-d0a15b60f4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3067335/29022601-a35ac1f2-7b2f-11e7-9067-fd6b626068ed.gif)

Would be nice to have something similar on VSCode.

My proposal is something like `autoClosingPairs` configuration allowing `open` and `close` info:

```json
{
  "comments": {
    "lineComment": "#",
    "blockComment": ["=begin", "=end"]
  },
  "brackets": [
    ["{", "}"],
    ["[", "]"],
    ["(", ")"],
    { "open": ["do", "if", "else"], "close": "end", "notIn": ["string", "comment"] }
  ],
  "autoClosingPairs": [
    ["{", "}"],
    ["[", "]"],
    ["(", ")"],
    ["`", "`"],
    { "open": "'", "close": "'", "notIn": ["string", "comment"] },
    { "open": "\"", "close": "\"", "notIn": ["string"] }
  ],
  "surroundingPairs": [
    ["{", "}"],
    ["[", "]"],
    ["(", ")"],
    ["\"", "\""],
    ["'", "'"],
    ["`", "`"]
  ]
}
```

Thanks for this great editor! :+1:

data.title: Support Configure Default build action only if task schema === 2.0.0
PHP
Cannot rename javascript variable in html file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
html-snippets|abu|0.1.0
vscode-css-formatter|aes|0.0.2
vscode-refresh-html|baj|0.0.2
npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
python|don|0.7.0
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14
matlab|Gim|0.5.0
search-node-modules|jas|1.1.1
vetur|oct|0.9.3
vuehelper|oys|0.1.0
es6-mocha-snippets|spo|0.0.2
nodejs-extension-pack|wad|0.1.9
bootstrap-3-snippets|wcw|0.1.0
JavaScriptSnippets|xab|1.4.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit in html file
2. Input code in `<script>` as follow:
```js
var foo='a';
console.log(foo)
``` 
3. Select `foo`, and press `F2` to rename it, nothing happen.
4. right click mouse, there no rename option in menu. 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: There is no any symbol for c/c++ after i update vscode to 1.14.2
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. i have installed c/c++ extension for vscode.
2. i can get the symbols by ctrl+shift+o when vscode is 1.12, but it can't work after updating to 1.14.2

Please , how can i solve the problem?
